summary: This bill, the Cutting Lead Exposure and Aviation Relief Skies Act (CLEAR Skies Act), proposes a tax credit for the production of unleaded aviation gasoline. The credit amount varies from $1.25 per gallon in 2026 to $1.05 in 2030.  The bill also mandates a study by the Comptroller General on the price of unleaded aviation gas and the effectiveness of the credit. It amends the Internal Revenue Code to include this credit and related provisions. The primary goal is to encourage the adoption of unleaded aviation fuel.
